website_summaries.verdict: The Nokia Lumia 630 is a cheap, vibrant alternative to Android and its Windows Phone 8.1 software is easy to use. The app store is still a problem though -- if you like getting new releases when your Android and iOS-toting friends do, a budget Android phone like the Moto G is still the way to go.
pros: The Nokia Lumia 630 has fun, colourful, interchangeable cases, its Windows Phone 8.1 software is easy to use and Nokia's bundled apps come in handy
cons: The Windows Phone app store still rarely receives new apps at the same time as Android or iOS, the screen is lower resolution than the similarly-priced Moto G, the camera doesn't particularly impress and it doesn't have 4G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Has so much to offer!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This phone has so much to offer. I saw a comparison on YouTube between Lumia 630 and Iphone 5 and as you can see it for yourself there are not many differences. But once that I got this Phone I'm really glad I bought it. Is everything that I expect it and more. I don't see the use of writing down specifications, because you can look for that in other reviews. But for business use is perfect. It's a friendly phone, I love that I don't have to learn another technology, I'm used to windows and now I have a windows phone!
customer_reviews.author: Vini M.

customer_reviews.title: I love my Nokia
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the duel sim, no English handbook, each time I use Skype and tried ending the call the screen goes blank and won't allow me to, apart from that, I love my Nokia.

customer_reviews.title: Took a $6 SIM card and it was good to go
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to use on the straight talk network. Took a $6 SIM card and it was good to go. My son loves it. I guess the benefit of the windows phone is it links up with his xbox live account. He also LOVES Cortana.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone as a backup, but it's not even good for that. Doesn't work with T-Mobile, and as a matter of fact will probably not work with other carriers in 2020. It is very very slow (much slower than other under $50 phones), and on top of it all, it was USED. There was a photo dated 2015 in the gallery (I bought the phone is 2020, so you can imagine my surprise). Don't waste your money, this one is not even good as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice phone and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice phone and easy to use. We did have one problem that aggravated the daylights out of us. I do not understand why a phone purchased in the US came to us all in Chinese. Every single option. I know all we have to do it change the language but think about trying to do that when all we have is symbols. I do not know if this was a joke or if they all come that way. But it was not funny or fun,.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Head

customer_reviews.title: The original phone was 4G LTE and the performance was much better. I feel like I was duped
customer_reviews.text: I bought the firs Nokia Lumia on Amazon for $100. Unfortunately I lost the phone and had to replace it. I bought what I thought was the same exact phone. The new phone is 3G, much slower and cost $130. The original phone was 4G LTE and the performance was much better. I feel like I was duped.

customer_reviews.title: my experience
customer_reviews.text: I have services with metro pcs and I can't seem to enjoy my phone, can't connect through 4 or 3 g, I can only access internet connections through my cable service provider or an open Wi-Fi also the dual SIM configuration is confusing, sometimes it doesn't send message through the contacts you have to dial the numbers first than it will recognize your contact .otherwise the phone is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: It's a good phone. It took a little while to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this phone on line through Cricket Wireless. It was $49.99 and for a limited time there's a $50.00 rebate. It's a good phone. It took a little while to get used to the Windows OS after using Android for several years. Cricket's unlimited rates are very reasonable, particularly if you have more than one line on the account.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lentini

product_meta.title: Nokia Lumia 630 RM-978 4.5 InchFactory Unlocked - International Version No Warranty (Black)
product_meta.description: The Lumia 630 runs on the advanced Windows 8.1 OS software, and is powered by Quad-Core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 Processor.
feature_bullets: 4.5-inch IPS LCD Multi-Touchscreen W/ ClearBlack display and Protective Corning Gorilla Glass 3
Microsoft Windows Phone 8.1, Quad-Core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 Processor, Chipset: Qualcomm Snapdragon 4, Adreno 305 Graphics
Internal Memory: 8GB, 512 MB RAM + microSD Slot Expandable up to 128GB

Unlocked cell phones are compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile as well as with GSM SIM cards (e.g. H20, Straight Talk, and select prepaid carriers). Unlocked cell phones will not work with CDMA Carriers like Sprint, Verizon, Boost or Virgin.
